DataElement.preferredName: Nucleic Acid Amplification Test Hepatitis C Virus Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Any of various amplification and detection strategies applied to detection of microorganism contamination in blood. It is most frequently used to detect recent viral infection in individuals during the latency period before seroconversion but can also be used to detect other types of blood contamination._an RNA virus which has been shown to be the major etiologic agent of non-A non-B hepatitis and causes substantial morbidity and mortality worldwide; also associated with cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma._The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Nucleic Acid Amplification Test Hepatitis C Virus
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any of various amplification and detection strategies applied to detection of microorganism contamination in blood. It is most frequently used to detect recent viral infection in individuals during the latency period before seroconversion but can also be used to detect other types of blood contamination._an RNA virus which has been shown to be the major etiologic agent of non-A non-B hepatitis and causes substantial morbidity and mortality worldwide; also associated with cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any of various amplification and detection strategies applied to detection of virus contamination in donor blood.  Specifically designed to detect recently infected individuals during the latency period before seroconversion.

Concepts.definition: Any of various amplification and detection strategies applied to detection of virus contamination in donor blood.  Specifically designed to detect recently infected individuals during the latency period before seroconversion.

Property.preferredDefinition: an RNA virus which has been shown to be the major etiologic agent of non-A non-B hepatitis and causes substantial morbidity and mortality worldwide; also associated with cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma.

Concepts.definition: A small, enveloped, positive sense single strand RNA virus in the family Flaviviridae. The genome consists of a single RNA molecule with a single open reading frame.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: .5/2/11: updated to the updated NCI definition of "Nucleic Acid Amplification Test " (concept "donor"removed ). no version needed per RA.wz

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created new version associated to different CD and Display Format as part of NMDP Date VD clean up 4/2009. mcooper Corrected def from KM change. AK 3/25/19

ReferenceDocuments.name: Date that the FDA licensed nu
ReferenceDocuments.description: Date that the FDA licensed nucleic acid amplification test (NAT) for hepatitis C virus was performed:

DataElement.changeDescription: Updated def with the removal of "donor" from the NAT def. AK 5/3/11
